博.definition: (bound form) abundant; plentiful; extensive; wide; to win; to gain; to play; to gamble; learned; well-read; (bound form) doctoral degree (abbr. for 博士[bo2shi4]); (bound form) blog (abbr. for 博客[bo2ke4])

博古.definition: Bo Gu (1907-1946), Soviet-trained Chinese Communist, journalist and propagandist, 1930s Left adventurist, subsequently rehabilitated, killed in air crash

博古通今.definition: conversant with things past and present; erudite and informed

博士.definition: doctor (as an academic degree); (old) person specialized in a skill or trade; (old) court academician

博士學位.definition: doctoral degree; PhD; same as Doctor of Philosophy 哲學博士學位|哲学博士学位

博士山.definition: Box Hill, a suburb of Melbourne, Australia with a large Chinese community

博士買驢.definition: (idiom) to act like the scholar who wrote at length about buying a donkey without even mentioning the word "donkey"; to write at length without ever getting to the point

博學多才.definition: erudite and multitalented (idiom); versatile and able

博德利圖書館.pinyin: Bo2 de2 li4 Tu2 shu1 guan3

博愛.definition: to show love and compassion for all humankind

博文.definition: blog article; to write a blog article (netspeak)

博文約禮.definition: vigorously pursuing knowledge, while scrupulously abiding by the rules of decorum (idiom)

博斯沃思.definition: Bosworth (name); Stephen Bosworth (1939-), US academic and diplomat, special representative for policy on North Korea from 2009
